text: I would suggest using the function ssh_new:\n\n

text: ssh_session ssh_new\t(\tvoid \t\t)\n\n

text:

Create a new ssh session.

speaker: Apiza
text:
Returns
A new ssh_session pointer, NULL on error.

speaker: Apiza

To connect, I would recommend the function

speaker: Programmer
text: what do the return values for ssh_connect

speaker: Programmer
text: what are the return values for ssh_connect

speaker: Apiza
text: Returns\nSSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR on error.\nSSH_AGAIN, if the session is in nonblocking mode, and call must be done again.

speaker: Programmer
text: what are the return values for ssh_userauth_password

speaker: Apiza
text:
Returns
SSH_AUTH_ERROR: A serious error happened.
SSH_AUTH_DENIED: Authentication failed: use another method
SSH_AUTH_PARTIAL: You've been partially authenticated, you still have to use another method
SSH_AUTH_SUCCESS: Authentication success
SSH_AUTH_AGAIN: In nonblocking mode, you've got to call this again later.

speaker: Apiza
text: Note\nMost server implementations do not permit changing the username during authentication. The username should only be set with ssh_options_set() only before you connect to the server.

speaker: Programmer
text: how do I check that the host is known in libssh

speaker: Apiza
text: There is a function int ssh_is_server_known\t(\tssh_session \tsession\t)\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: Description\nCheck if the server is known.\nChecks the user's known host file for a previous connection to the current server.

speaker: Programmer
text: what does ssh_is_server_known return

speaker: Apiza
text:
Returns
SSH_SERVER_KNOWN_OK: The server is known and has not changed.
SSH_SERVER_KNOWN_CHANGED: The server key has changed. Either you are under attack or the administrator changed the key. You HAVE to warn the user about a possible attack.
SSH_SERVER_FOUND_OTHER: The server gave use a key of a type while we had an other type recorded. It is a possible attack.
SSH_SERVER_NOT_KNOWN: The server is unknown. User should confirm the MD5 is correct.
SSH_SERVER_FILE_NOT_FOUND: The known host file does not exist. The host is thus unknown. File will be created if host key is accepted.
SSH_SERVER_ERROR: Some error happened.

speaker: Apiza
text: int ssh_channel_send_eof\t(\tssh_channel channel\t)\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
Description 
Send an end of file on the channel. 
This doesn't close the channel. You may still read from it but not write.

text:
Parameters 
channel: The channel to send the eof to.

speaker: Apiza
text: Returns \nSSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred.

speaker: Programmer
text: how do I open a channel session

speaker: Apiza
text: This function may help with deciphering a disconnect message\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: const char* ssh_get_disconnect_message\t(\tssh_session \tsession\t)

speaker: Apiza
text: This function should let you open a channel session\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: int ssh_channel_open_session\t(\tssh_channel \tchannel\t)\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
Description
Open a session channel (suited for a shell, not TCP forwarding).

speaker: Apiza
text:
Parameters
channel: An allocated channel.

speaker: Apiza
text:
Returns
SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.

speaker: Apiza
text:
See also
ssh_channel_open_forward()
ssh_channel_request_env()
ssh_channel_request_shell()
ssh_channel_request_exec()

/* Error return codes */

speaker: Apiza
text:
#define SSH_OK 0 /* No error */
 #define SSH_ERROR -1 /* Error of some kind */
 #define SSH_AGAIN -2 /* The nonblocking call must be repeated */
 #define SSH_EOF -127 /* We have already a eof */

speaker: Programmer
text: tell me about sftp_open

speaker: Programmer
text: can you give me an example of sftp_open

speaker: Apiza
Apiza
text:
Description
Open a file on the server.

speaker: Apiza
text:
Parameters
session: The sftp session handle.
file: The file to be opened.
accesstype: Is one of O_RDONLY, O_WRONLY or O_RDWR which request opening the file read-only,write-only or read/write. Acesss may also be bitwise-or'd with one or more of the following: O_CREAT - If the file does not exist it will be created. O_EXCL - When used with O_CREAT, if the file already exists it is an error and the open will fail. O_TRUNC - If the file already exists it will be truncated.
mode: Mode specifies the permissions to use if a new file is created. It is modified by the process's umask in the usual way: The permissions of the created file are (mode & ~umask)

speaker: Apiza
text:
Returns
A sftp file handle, NULL on error with ssh and sftp error set.

speaker: Apiza
text: References ssh_buffer_free(), ssh_buffer_new(), and ssh_string_from_char().\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: See also\nsftp_get_error()
